title: Online check-in resumed at 2pm on Saturday, situation being monitored — AirAsia
summary: AirAsia resumed its online check-in operation at 2pm on Saturday, after being thrown into turmoil by a global information technology (IT) glitch a day earlier.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 20): AirAsia resumed its online check-in operation at 2pm on Saturday, after being thrown into turmoil by a global information technology (IT) glitch a day earlier.

AirAsia deputy group chief executive officer (airline operations) Datuk Captain Chester Voo said the low-cost carrier will continue to monitor the situation.

He advised passengers to arrive early at the airport to avoid potential delays and long queues.

title: Malaysian coast guard says tanker involved in fire has left site
summary: KUALA LUMPUR/SINGAPORE (July 20): Malaysia's coast guard said on Saturday that one of the two large oil tankers involved in a collision that led to fires on both, had left the location of the accident and was believed to have turned off its tracking system.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR/SINGAPORE (July 20): Malaysia's coast guard said on Saturday that one of the two large oil tankers involved in a collision that led to fires on both, had left the location of the accident and was believed to have turned off its tracking system.

The coast guard said it was tracking the whereabouts of the Sao Tome and Principe-flagged tanker Ceres I, which was suspected to be within Malaysian waters.

The Ceres I was involved in a collision reported ea

title: Fadillah: Govt agencies unaffected by worldwide IT disruption
summary: The global information technology (IT) disruption that began on Friday had not impacted government agencies' operations, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof.
content:
SHAH ALAM (July 20): The global information technology (IT) disruption that began on Friday had not impacted government agencies' operations, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof.

He clarified that only the aviation sector had been affected by the disruption so far. However, proactive measures are being taken to address and mitigate the issues effectively.

“This is a challenge when we rely on technology. If there are technology glitches, we face

title: See you in court, Umno sec-gen tells Rembia assemblyman who has joined PAS
summary: Umno secretary general Datuk Dr Asyraf Wajdi Dusuki on Saturday presented a document allegedly signed by Rembia assemblyman Datuk Muhammad Jailani Khamis, detailing the implications the latter would face for joining another political party or becoming an independent.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 20): Umno secretary general Datuk Dr Asyraf Wajdi Dusuki on Saturday presented a document allegedly signed by Rembia assemblyman Datuk Muhammad Jailani Khamis, detailing the implications the latter would face for joining another political party or becoming an independent.

Asyraf Wajdi said that the Rembia assemblymen had signed the Barisan Nasional (BN) candidate representation agreement before the 15th Melaka state election in 2021, similar to all other BN candidates during t

title: CelcomDigi says global IT outage has little to zero impact on its services
summary: CelcomDigi Bhd (KL:CDB) said there had been “no or limited impact” on customers and its operations during the global information technology (IT) outage triggered by a CrowdStrike software update on Friday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 20): CelcomDigi Bhd (KL:CDB) said there had been “no or limited impact” on customers and its operations during the global information technology (IT) outage triggered by a CrowdStrike software update on Friday.

In a statement on Saturday, the mobile network operator said network services were unaffected, and that its customers were able to use data and voice services as normal.

“Some disruption was experienced for

title: AirAsia continues operations amid system disruption, says manual processing remains most reliable
summary: AirAsia will continue with its operations to connect guests to their destinations, while noting that manual processing remains the most reliable and secure method for now, as the airline makes every effort towards recovery, following the global information technology (IT) glitch on Friday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 20): AirAsia will continue with its operations to connect guests to their destinations, while noting that manual processing remains the most reliable and secure method for now, as the airline makes every effort towards recovery, following the global information technology (IT) glitch on Friday.

In a statement updated just after noon on Saturday, the low-cost carrier said it had been working around the clock towards recovering its departure control systems, in the aft

title: King’s installation: 14 roads to reopen in stages, say police
summary: The 14 roads closed for the installation ceremony of the 17th King of Malaysia will be reopened in stages, said Bukit Aman Traffic Investigation and Enforcement Department (JSPT) director Datuk Seri Mohd Yusri Hassan Basri.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 20): The 14 roads closed for the installation ceremony of the 17th King of Malaysia will be reopened in stages, said Bukit Aman Traffic Investigation and Enforcement Department (JSPT) director Datuk Seri Mohd Yusri Hassan Basri.

He said the roads were closed from 8am on Saturday to facilitate the smooth passage of royal vehicles and dignitaries attending the ceremony.

“The roads will be closed during the royal gue

title: My Say: Duties and potential liabilities of nominee directors and their appointors
summary: Nominee directors are common in Malaysia. Section 217 of the Companies Act 2016 (CA 2016) expressly lays down that a nominee director is one who is appointed to the company by virtue of being an employee of the nominator, or as a representative of a member, employer or debenture holder, and he ha...
content:
This article first appeared in Forum, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on July 15, 2024 - July 21, 2024

Nominee directors are common in Malaysia. Section 217 of the Companies Act 2016 (CA 2016) expressly lays down that a nominee director is one who is appointed to the company by virtue of being an employee of the nominator, or as a representative of a member, employer or debenture holder, and he has a mandatory duty to act in the best interests of the company.

title: King pledges to discharge duties faithfully, honestly for country and people, at installation ceremony
summary: His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, the 17th King of Malaysia, pledged to discharge his duties faithfully, honestly and fairly, with full consideration of all segments of society, to safeguard the well-being and sovereignty of the country.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 20): His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, the 17th King of Malaysia, pledged to discharge his duties faithfully, honestly and fairly, with full consideration of all segments of society, to safeguard the well-being and sovereignty of the country.

“I would like to express my gratitude to my brother rulers, who have placed their trust in me, and given me the honour to take over the duties as the head of state,” the King said in his royal address at his installation ceremony at Istana

title: Projected 2Q growth of 5.8% will strengthen nation — PM
summary: Malaysia's economic growth, projected at 5.8% in the second quarter of 2024 (2Q2024), will enable the country to rise as a strong nation, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 20): Malaysia's economic growth, projected at 5.8% in the second quarter of 2024 (2Q2024), will enable the country to rise as a strong nation, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

Anwar said under the Madani Economy, the government had promised better job opportunities, training and technology transfer to move the country towards a digital and energy transition.

"Malaysia has broken through the wall of uncertainty by registering

title: The Week Ahead: Attention on inflation data, monetary policy decisions
summary: Following the implementation of diesel subsidy rationalisation on June 10, all eyes will be on its effects on the nation’s June Consumer Price Index (CPI) data, which will be released on July 22. By Bloomberg’s estimates, Malaysia’s June CPI will likely jump to a 13-month high of 2.6% year on year (y-o-y), largely reflecting the effects of the rationalisation.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on July 22, 2024 - July 28, 2024

Following the implementation of diesel subsidy rationalisation on June 10, all eyes will be on its effects on the nation’s June Consumer Price Index (CPI) data, which will be released on July 22. By Bloomberg’s estimates, Malaysia’s June CPI will likely jump to a 13-month high of 2.6% year on year (y-o-y), largely reflecting the effects of the rationalisation.

title: Making MM2H a winner
summary: Once a popular second home programme, the Malaysia My Second Home (MM2H) scheme has witnessed a sharp dip in popularity over the years.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 20): Once a popular second home programme, the Malaysia My Second Home (MM2H) scheme has witnessed a sharp dip in popularity over the years.

The government had rolled out a revamped version of the programme, known as eMM2H, in August 2021, which then home minister Datuk Seri Hamzah Zainudin said would ensure that the country could still attract the “higher quality” participants it needed while also reducing the vulnerability of the programme to exploitation.

title: King's installation: Anwar, Singapore's Lee Hsien Loong arrive at Istana Negara
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim and his wife Datuk Seri Dr Wan Azizah Wan Ismail arrived at Istana Negara to attend the installation ceremony of His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim as the 17th King of Malaysia on Saturday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 20): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim and his wife Datuk Seri Dr Wan Azizah Wan Ismail arrived at Istana Negara to attend the installation ceremony of His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim as the 17th King of Malaysia on Saturday.

The car carrying the couple arrived at the main porch of Istana Negara at 8.45am.

Also attending the ceremony were Senior Minister of Singapore Lee Hsien Loong and his wife Ho Ching.

title: Renewable electricity to outstrip coal next year: IEA
summary: PARIS: The amount of electricity produced from renewable sources worldwide is set to surpass output from coal-fired plants for the first time in 2025, the International Energy Agency said Friday.The forecast comes as electricity demand is set to rise four ...
content:
PARIS: The amount of electricity produced from renewable sources worldwide is set to surpass output from coal-fired plants for the first time in 2025, the International Energy Agency said Friday.

The forecast comes as electricity demand is set to rise four percent this year and next, up from 2.5 percent in 2023.

That would be the highest annual growth since 2007, excepting spikes seen after the global financial crisis that began that year and during the Covid-19 recovery, the Paris-based agency said.

Soaring demand

title: Japan's MUFG cuts CEO, five other executives' pay after firewall breaches
summary: TOKYO: Japan's largest banking group Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG) will cut the pay of six executives following the breaching of "firewall" regulations at its banking and securities arms, it said on Friday.In June, the Financial Services Agency (...
content:
TOKYO: Japan's largest banking group Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG) will cut the pay of six executives following the breaching of "firewall" regulations at its banking and securities arms, it said on Friday.

In June, the Financial Services Agency (FSA) ordered MUFG's banking and securities units to submit business improvement plans in the most high profile financial regulatory action in Japan since the securities arm of rival Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group was indicted on market manipulation charges in 2022.</

title: Japan attracts record 3.14 mln June visitors as weak yen draws travellers
summary: TOKYO: Japan set a record high for monthly visitors in June, official data showed on Friday, as its weak yen fuelled a tourism boom that is becoming a key driver for the economy.The number of foreign visitors for business ...
content:
TOKYO: Japan set a record high for monthly visitors in June, official data showed on Friday, as its weak yen fuelled a tourism boom that is becoming a key driver for the economy.

The number of foreign visitors for business and leisure was 3.14 million last month, exceeding the previous monthly record of 3.08 million set in March and up from 3.04 million in May, data from the Japan National Tourism Organization (JNTO) showed.

The 17.78 million arrivals through June were also a record for a half-year period and on pace to s

title: Delay in stake sale?
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Sarawak government will proceed with its acquisition of Affin Bank Bhd even though its plans to wrap up the deal may have been scuppered, slightly.On Friday, media organisations were initially invited by the Sarawak Public Communications ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Sarawak government will proceed with its acquisition of Affin Bank Bhd even though its plans to wrap up the deal may have been scuppered, slightly.

On Friday, media organisations were initially invited by the Sarawak Public Communications Unit (Ukas) to a signing ceremony here with regards to the "acquisition of shares". However this was subsequently changed to the signing of a memorandum of understanding (MoU).

A financial weekly reported earlier that a planned sale and purchase agreement (SPA) between

title: Malaysia's Q2 GDP grows fastest since Q4 2022?
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's economy may have expanded at the fastest rate in six quarter for the second quarter (Q2) of 2024.The Q2 gross domestic product was expected to expand 5.8 per cent based on advance estimates released by the Department ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's economy may have expanded at the fastest rate in six quarter for the second quarter (Q2) of 2024.

The Q2 gross domestic product was expected to expand 5.8 per cent based on advance estimates released by the Department of Statistics Malaysia (DOSM) today.

This would be the highest quarterly growth recorded since Q4 2022 which stood at 7.4 per cent.

Bank Muamalat chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said the 5.8 per cent was extremely beyond what the market had expected.

title: Oil settles at one-month low on Gaza ceasefire hopes
summary: Oil prices settled over US$2 lower on Friday at their lowest level since mid-June as investors eyed a possible ceasefire in Gaza, while a strengthened dollar drove values down further.
content:
Brent crude prices settled down US$2.48, or 2.9%, to US$82.63 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude futures dropped US$2.69, or 3.3%, to US$80.13.

HOUSTON: Oil prices settled over US$2 lower on Friday at their lowest level since mid-June as investors eyed a possible ceasefire in Gaza, while a strengthened dollar drove values down further.

title: Wall St ends lower in aftermath of global tech outage
summary: US stocks extended their slump on Friday as lingering chaos related to a global technical outage caused by a software glitch added uncertainty to an already-anxious market.
content:
The Dow fell 377.49 points, or 0.93%, to 40,287.53, the S&P 500 lost 39.59 points, or 0.71%, to 5,505 and the Nasdaq dropped 144.28 points, or 0.81%, to 17,726.94.

content:

title: How the collection of taxes can help the needy
summary: Economists generally believe that the government’s tax collection plays a significant role in helping to improve the social welfare of Malaysians, especially among the needy class.
content:
Economist Geoffrey Williams.

ECONOMISTS generally believe that the government’s tax collection plays a significant role in helping to improve the social welfare of Malaysians, especially among the needy class.

Interestingly, however, they offer varying opinions on the what and the how: which kind of taxes to be collected and the methods for doing so.

title: Delay of last two digital banks ‘not surprising’
summary: The delay in the launch of the two remaining digital banks in Malaysia does not come as a surprise as Bank Negara is normally very stringent when it comes to deposit-taking, and other banking activities.
content:
The delay in the launch of the two remaining digital banks in Malaysia does not come as a surprise as Bank Negara is normally very stringent when it comes to deposit-taking, and other banking activities.

Furthermore, there are many hurdles to cross before a digital bank can actually come to fruition.

title: Financial strategies to counter weakening ringgit
summary: The weakening of the Malaysian ringgit against the US dollar can potentially erode the value of your ringgit-denominated savings.
content:
A weakening ringgit shouldn’t be a cause for panic. Instead, view it as an opportunity to broaden your investment horizons.

THE weakening of the Malaysian ringgit against the US dollar can potentially erode the value of your ringgit-denominated savings.

This depreciation has been driven by various factors beyond our control. As a result, many Malaysian investors are seeking ways to diversify their portfol

title: KTMB’s new Asean Express to complement port operations
summary: It was a long-awaited development of the Pan-Asian railway, which will seamlessly link Asean to China. And Malaysia is now on the bandwagon as Keretapi Tanah Melayu Bhd (KTMB) recently launched the Asean Express.
content:
The Asean Express is seen as a transformative leap in regional logistics. — Bernama

IT was a long-awaited development of the Pan-Asian railway, which will seamlessly link Asean to China. And Malaysia is now on the bandwagon as Keretapi Tanah Melayu Bhd (KTMB) recently launched the Asean Express.

title: Mall operators remain cautious
summary: Despite a steady first half-year, retail players remain cautious about the industry’s outlook for the remainder of the year, amid the rising cost of living that could dampen consumer spending.
content:
Malaysia Shopping Malls Association president Phang Sau Lian.

DESPITE a steady first half-year, retail players remain cautious about the industry’s outlook for the remainder of the year, amid the rising cost of living that could dampen consumer spending.

Malaysia Shopping Malls Association president Phang Sau Lian says the group remains cautiously optimistic about the outlook of the local market for the r

title: Blackstone’s Gray expects ‘new cycle’ for real estate market
summary: Blackstone Inc president Jon Gray says that the world’s largest alternative asset manager is ready to pounce on a pickup in property markets.
content:
Blackstone president Jon Gray. — Bloomberg

BLACKSTONE Inc president Jon Gray says that the world’s largest alternative asset manager is ready to pounce on a pickup in property markets.

“The cost of capital has begun to decline, which should be further helped by Federal Reserve rate cuts later this year,” he tells Wall Street analysts after the firm reported its second-quarter results.

title: Rental rate uptrend
summary: Rental rates over the next 12 months are expected to climb moderately from the first quarter of 2024 (1Q24) level of RM1,920 per month.
content:
RENTAL rates over the next 12 months are expected to climb moderately from the first quarter of 2024 (1Q24) level of RM1,920 per month.

The average monthly rental price in Malaysia over the past two years is RM1,895, slightly lower than the 1Q24 average.

title: Five decades of innovation and inspired creations
summary: As S P Setia Bhd celebrates its 50th anniversary this year, the property developer said it will continue its commitment to not just be a “house builder” but to change and create spaces where people live, learn, work and play.
content:
Going global: The goal of the company now is to take the brand international after successfully launching projects in Singapore, the United Kingdom, Australia and Vietnam.

SHAH ALAM: As S P Setia Bhd celebrates its 50th anniversary this year, the property developer said it will continue its commitment to not just be a “house builder” but to change and create spaces where people live, learn, work and play.

title: Builders on track for continuing, solid growth with project flows
summary: The construction industry, a vital pillar of the nation’s economy, is witnessing a significant revival.
content:
Tradeview Capital Sdn Bhd chief executive officer Ng Zhu Hann.

THE construction industry, a vital pillar of the nation’s economy, is witnessing a significant revival.

With ambitious infrastructure projects, increased foreign investments, and robust government support, the sector is currently turning heads.

title: Public-private pact the right way to go
summary: Financing for the proposed multibillion-ringgit Kuala Lumpur-Singapore High Speed Rail (HSR) will be key to making a public-private partnership (PPP) the right choice for the project.
content:
Big picture: Loke says the decision on the HSR will be made by year-end. — Bernama

PETALING JAYA: Financing for the proposed multibillion-ringgit Kuala Lumpur-Singapore High Speed Rail (HSR) will be key to making a public-private partnership (PPP) the right choice for the project.

The decision to proceed with the project is expected to be made by the end of the year, according to Transport Minister Anthon
